techmeme.title: Klarity, which uses AI to let companies automate reviews of invoices and other documents, raised a $70M Series B led by Nat Friedman and Daniel Gross (Kalley Huang/The Information)
Uber has begun locking NYC drivers out of its app during low demand periods to fight a local rule that requires drivers be paid for idle time between rides (Evan Gorelick/Bloomberg)
Nvidia stock is down ~15% from June 20, losing ~$500B in market cap, after becoming the most valuable company on June 18; its CEO recently sold ~$95M in shares (Financial Times)
Meta has seemingly stopped trying as hard to moderate its services, overrun with AI spam and scams; X gutting safety staff may have lowered the industry's bar (Jason Koebler/404 Media)
The Surface Laptop 7 and Surface Pro 11 receive a repairability score of 8 out of 10, far better than the first Surface Laptop, which got a 0 in June 2017 (Shahram Mokhtari/iFixit News)
